Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as c056aa7aa2438d16b1a3f1db20e6aac2694ca455

Looks good, modulo ignoring any content-type directives.
Thanks for doing this!

Should this be for the content-type mime-type of "text/html" regardless of any additional content-type directives?
In other words, can we change this to contentType.startsWith("text/html").

I am worried that a network scanner will request URI / with a slightly different content-type, such as "text/html; charset=UTF-8" (space added).  As coded in this patchset, this will cause bmcweb to omit various repsonse headers.  then the scanner will flag security issues.

I am not an HTML expert and did not find the answer in https://jazz07.rchland.ibm.com:13443/jazz/web/projects/CSSD#action=com.ibm.team.workitem.viewWorkItem&id=603937

> Should this be for the content-type mime-type of "text/html" regardless of any additional content-type directives?

My thinking was that we don't really have a good content-type header parser, and there's literally only one place where we can set content-type html (in the static files loader) and there we set UTF-8.  Note, this is also the reason why we can do an exact match, instead of an HTTP-specified case insensitive match.

> In other words, can we change this to contentType.startsWith("text/html").

ACK.  I didn't think about using starts_with, but I guess that works.  Will change.

> 
> I am worried that a network scanner will request URI / with a slightly different content-type, such as "text/html; charset=UTF-8" (space added).

>  As coded in this patchset, this will cause bmcweb to omit various repsonse headers.  then the scanner will flag security issues.
> 
> I am not an HTML expert and did not find the answer in https://jazz07.rchland.ibm.com:13443/jazz/web/projects/CSSD#action=com.ibm.team.workitem.viewWorkItem&id=603937


to be clear, this is is checking crow::RESPONSE.getHeaderValue(), which a network scanner doesn't have any input into.  The content-type is set from within bmcweb, from a hardcoded list of possible values, so there's (hopefully) no way to influence this outside of bmcweb.


FYI, I don't have access to the link you published.
I've made the change asked for (using starts_with).
I don't know a ton here but it seems reasonable to me.
